message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CV, cs.CR 

The paper deals with cost-sensitive classification and regression, which are topics that fall under the umbrella of machine learning. The paper introduces methods and plots that can work with any off-the-shelf predictive technique, which suggests that it could be relevant to a broad range of machine learning subfields. However, the focus on cost-sensitive classification and regression suggests that it is most likely to be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of feature configuration and the experimental results suggest that it could also be relevant to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the mention of cost context and the need to minimise joint cost suggest that it could be relevant to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
